data.text:
Deepak said:

thop said:

You can set the japanese SH4 to english language.

Then what will be the difference between it and English vers? But I may get it if it is true. I can't wait.

From df0 at Silenthillforum.co.uk

http://www.silenthillforum.co.uk/forum/showthread.php?s=&threadid=10711

Hi,

I can confirm the following about the PAL release of Silent Hill 4:

1. English, German (Deutsch), French (Francais), Italian (Italiano) and Spanish (Espanol) subtitles.

2. No 60 Hz mode. Small black borders, I did not notice any difference in 'speed'.

That's it

Fafalada said:

Yeah I can see where you come from on display thing. Anyway after seeing PC version near perfect look on TV, I was pretty much won over too, so I may as well hold off on PS2 SH4.

And SH is a slow game which i don't think will suffer too much from the lack of a controller. I'll still miss it though...

Although speaking of this, why not get one of these?

http://www.jandaman.com/thestore/prods/psxusb5.html

Playing SilentHill game with mouse and KB feels like you're violating the game in a way

Or you could always go for one of those DS clones for PC. I dunno if they're any good though, I never actually tried using one.

I use ELECOM's (Japanese) USB PS2 gamepad adaptor for PC, the key map is simply perfect for SH3 (exactly the same as PS2 SH3).

Now, one thing. Why is it that PC games are cheaper than console games?

Publisher don't pay royalties on PC. A contrario, on console the publisher can't get away without giving ~15% of the price as a license fee.

Many GameCube games sell almost as cheap as PC games nowadays. Bless Nintendo. ^^

So did dreamcast games....not sure if it was just towards the end of their life or throughout the entire thing though.(I think only the less hyped gamecube games are $40, a new zelda would be $50)

BTW, is deus ex 2 still $50 on pc? I avoided buying that since it was more than the $40 I was used to paying for a pc game.
